answer:
In 1973/74 when you received measles, mumps and rubella vaccines seperately, they would be considered dose one for each vaccine. According to History of Immunization in BC, in 1981 the combined measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine was provided for all children 12 months of age and older. If you uncertain if your records from 1981/83 contained measles, contact your local health unit to request a nurse to review your records. Use the health unit finder.
Immunization Nurse
question: I was separately vaccinated for Measles, Mumps and Rubella in 1973/74. I also have BC immunization records for Mumps and Rubella boosters in '81 and '83 respectively. Would either of these boosters have contained the Measles booster?
question_variation_0: what year did vaccinated for measles contain measles booster
